subject: Re: Better comunications,
author: mrscaptainjack2
full_text:
I have a question:  I've read on one website that it's better to limit your sessions to ten minutes (because it's supposedly exhausting to the entities to communicate), and I've read in the manual for the minibox (I think) that it takes a couple of hours for the entities to really get going.  Which would you guys say is more correct?  I know it would wear me out to listen back to more than ten or fifteen minutes, as it's such an exhausting process to go over the tape!

Also, I've been putting off doing another session for weeks and weeks.  First I was sick with the flu, then I was tired every day...and I know it's better to be well rested, in a good mood, etc. when doing a session.  Now I'm about ready to try again, and I am wondering if I've maybe lost my "Steve" guy (the entity whom I don't know and wasn't related to).  The last time I did a session, he was rather flippant, giving me a bunch of bullshit answers, so I think I'd like to lose him and give some other entities (or hopefully my relatives) a chance to speak.  Has anyone here had one entity who monopolized things?  Did it go away when you quit for a while?  I've read some posts in other places where people refer to a "tech".  Could Steve be my "tech?"  What's a tech?  A helper on the other side?  I wouldn't want to get rid of my "tech" inadvertently, but right now I'm thinking Steve is more of a nuisance than a helper!  I'd love to hear you guys' opinion about this!

P.S. -- Frank, have a safe trip!






--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, SnowfireL@... wrote:
>
> One of the list member notes that we all seem to be getting better  
> communications, "communication is starting to move  away from the basic one and two 
> word messages and answers and becoming more  detailed in it's content.I 
> suggest that we all try to  dedicate one certain topic per session and attempt 
> to gather as much information  as we can on that specific topic."
>  
> This seems to be a great idea,  I  wonder if me leaving them to watch TV 
> sometimes, and letting them watch the  baseball games of their choice helps, 
> it allows them  to practice using the  radio for an extended period of time, 
> and talk amongst themselves when I am not  in the same room, once and awhile 
> I will hear them saying something about me, or  one is asking another "what 
> is she doing" someone will say, "she's in her room,  on the phone," 
> sometimes they ask what or when I'm going to fix dinner, or what  I am cooking.  
> It's kind of cool, they can also shut it down when they are  pestered by 
> negative people or abusive's, some of which say they are "in jail"  over there.  
> Sometimes. they want to know, "when will you record" I  guess, they kind of 
> like lining up to say names and such, or they say, as the  recording is 
> ending, "it's over all ready" :( in a sad tone of voice.)   It's nice hearing so 
> many people, saying "I love you" never knew I had so many  friends, it's 
> nice!  sf
>
